title: Tonga A national rugby union team
text:
Tonga A is a national representative <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> team of the <a href="Rugby%20union%20in%20Tonga">Tongan rugby union</a>. It is the second-tier side to the <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Tonga national rugby union team</a>. Tonga A competes in the <a href="World%20Rugby%20Pacific%20Challenge">Pacific Challenge</a>, formerly known as the Pacific Rugby Cup, against teams including <a href="Samoa%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Samoa A</a> and <a href="Fiji%20Warriors">Fiji Warriors</a>. Since 2017, the team has also competed in the <a href="Americas%20Pacific%20Challenge">Americas Pacific Challenge</a>.
Between 2006 and 2010, Tonga was represented by two teams at the Pacific Rugby Cup; <a href="Tau%27uta%20Reds">Tau'uta Reds</a> and <a href="Tautahi%20Gold">Tautahi Gold</a>.
In 2010, Tonga A played three matches against other national A teams as an invited side to the <a href="Americas%20Rugby%20Championship">Americas Rugby Championship</a>. Earlier in that year Tonga A also played two matches against in the first <a href="Punjas%20Rugby%20Series">Punjas Series</a>. The Tongans had one win and one loss but lost the series on aggregate scores. This result was repeated in the second (and concluding) Punjas Series in 2011.
The Pacific Rugby Cup was reorganised in 2011, and has since been mainly contested by national 'A' teams. The Tonga A side became the sole Tongan representative in the PRC from then on.
International matches.
